title: Kiyani urges opposition to find alternative protests strategy; calls for constructive dialogue with govt
content:
ISLAMABAD, Jul 27 (APP):Pakistan Muslim League Nawaz (PML-N) leader Bilal Azhar Kayani Saturday urged all opposition parties to rethink their protest strategies and explore alternative methods that do not disrupt life of the public.
Talking to a private new channel, he emphasized the need for constructive dialogue and peaceful expression of dissent between government and opposition parties to resolve their differences and finding solutions to problems that benefit the nation.
Kiyani acknowledged the right to protest, but stressed that it should not come at the cost of citizens’ daily lives.
He encouraged opposition parties to engage in meaningful discussions with the government, focusing on policy reforms and constructive criticism.
The call for alternative protest strategies comes as a response to recent road blockades and demonstrations that have caused inconvenience to the general public.
Kiyani’ s appeal aims to promote a culture of peaceful and responsible dissent, where opposing views are expressed without harming the community.
By advocating for constructive dialogue, Kiyani hopes to create an environment where political parties can work together to address the nation’s challenges, rather than resorting to measures that hinder progress.
His message emphasizes the need for collective responsibility and collaboration in building a better future.
